data.name: Calculator for expressions with fractions
data.description: **Calculator for expressions with fractions** Program a function that evaluates a mathematical expression in a String which contains fractions: ```( 1|2 + 1 ) * 1|6 / 3 + 5|16 ``` *Expressions* The expression is composed of the four operations +, -, \*, /, (nested) parantheses and numbers. All numbers in the expression are either a natural number or a a fraction. A fraction has a numerator and a denominator, both natural numbers. One or both of them can be negative. As doubles and floats are not needed for this Kata they are disabled. *Format of input and output* Fractions are notated with a '|' to separate numerator and denominator, so three quarters would be denoted as ```3|4 ``` Spaces can occur between numbers and operators but not within fractions or between numbers and their sign. The return value is a string representation of the with the '|' as separator where the fraction has to be reduced ( ```21|14 ``` is wrong ```3|2 ``` is correct). If the fraction is negative, the sign **must** precede the numerator (```-3|2 ``` is correct, ```3|-2 ``` is wrong. Yes, negative denominator is valid *input* but invalid *output*). If the resulting fraction corresponds to a natural number, just return the number. Have a look at the test cases for clarification if needed. If there is the attempt to divide by zero (either by giving a zero-denominator or by dividing by a zero-valued number) an ArithmeticException has to be thrown. Apart from that the tests will only be valid expressions. If you solved the Kata Precise fractions pt. 1 - basics already your class *Fraction* will come in handy. Just remove the toDecimal-Method as the Test Cases rejects Solutions with floats or doubles
